intro: Pteracanthus agrestis, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Pteracanthus agrestis is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
